item.title: Sensex and Nifty Slip Nearly 1% Amid Broad-Based Sector Declines; Adani Enterprises Leads Losses
item.description: Indian equity markets closed sharply lower on 26 Jan 2026, with the Sensex falling 0.94% and the Nifty 50 declining 0.95%, dragged down by broad-based selling across sectors. Large caps underperformed, while mid and small caps faced even steeper losses amid weak global cues and subdued investor sentiment ahead of key corporate earnings. Time: 4 hours ago

item.title: Sensex and Nifty Slip Nearly 1% Amid Broad Market Weakness; Utilities Sector Leads Declines
item.description: Indian equity markets closed sharply lower on 26 Jan 2026, with the Sensex falling 0.94% to 81,537.70 and the Nifty 50 declining 0.95% to 25,048.65. The broad-based sell-off was led by large caps, dragging the Nifty Next 50 down by 1.97%, while mid and small caps also suffered notable losses amid weak market breadth and subdued investor sentiment. Time: 5 hours ago

item.title: Sensex and Nifty Slip Nearly 1% Amid Broad Sector Declines and Heavy Adani Losses
item.description: Indian equity markets closed sharply lower on 26 Jan 2026, with the Sensex falling 769.67 points (-0.94%) to 81,537.70 and the Nifty 50 declining 241.25 points (-0.95%) to 25,048.65. The broad-based sell-off was marked by all 38 sectors on the BSE ending in the red, led by the Utilities sector which dropped 3.52%. Market breadth was heavily negative, with only 66 advances against 433 declines across the BSE 500 index, signalling widespread investor caution amid weak global cues and sector-specific pressures. Time: 6 hours ago

item.title: Sensex and Nifty Slip Nearly 1% Amid Broad-Based Sector Declines and Heavy Selling Pressure
item.description: Indian equity markets closed sharply lower on 26 Jan 2026, with the Sensex and Nifty both retreating nearly 1% amid widespread selling pressure. All sectors ended in the red, led by utilities and realty, while heavyweight Adani Group stocks suffered steep declines. Market breadth was heavily skewed towards declines, reflecting cautious investor sentiment amid mixed global cues and subdued domestic triggers. Time: 7 hours ago

item.title: Sensex and Nifty Slip Nearly 1% Amid Broad-Based Sector Declines; Adani Stocks Lead Losses
item.description: Indian equity markets witnessed a broad-based sell-off on 26 Jan 2026, with the Sensex and Nifty both closing near their intraday lows. The benchmark Sensex declined by 769.67 points, or 0.94%, to settle at 81,537.70, while the Nifty 50 index dropped 241.25 points, or 0.95%, ending at 25,048.65. Market breadth was overwhelmingly negative as all 38 sectors tracked by the S&P BSE declined, led by utilities and realty, signalling widespread investor caution amid subdued global cues and sector-specific pressures. Time: 8 hours ago
